moves.1. b3 d5 2. Bb2 c5 3. e3 Nc6 4. Bb5 Qb6: I decide to try something new.
moves.5. a4 Bd7 6. Nf3 a6: I put the question to the bishop.
moves.8... e6 9. Qf3 Nf6: I block the threat of mate on f7.
moves.10. Nxc6 Qxc6 11. Bxf6: This is the first red flag.
moves.11... gxf6 12. Qxf6 Rg8 13. Qf3: He protects g2 and stops the threat of Bg7! winning a rook.
moves.15. Qd1: ? Wrong way to protect. Ra3 was best.
moves.15... O-O-O: Since the f-pawn is no longer threatened.
moves.18... Qc6: Threatening a deadly discovered attack on g2.
moves.19. g3: Since I don't have a lsb this is fine.
moves.22. Ra2 Qd6: Protecting and getting ready for a deadly assault.
moves.23... Rxg3+: This is very unsound and I should have lost. But as it turned out, this was the winning move.
moves.25. Kh1 Qh3+ 26. Kg1 Rg8+: The rook comes into the fray.
moves.27. Kf2 Qh2+: After ...Rg2+, Ke3 the attack has lost some momentum.
moves.32... Qf4 33. Kb2: ? 1: the king was perfectly safe. 2: this puts it on a dark square(same as my queen) 3: this wastes a vital tempo.
moves.34. Ka3 b5: I have to sac more to stay alive.
moves.35. cxb5 axb5 36. b4: ? He thought it was sound. This loses.
moves.36... Qc4: My queen hits all his vulnerable spots. f1, c3, and it protects b5.
moves.37. axb5: His c-pawn was in dire need of protection.
moves.39. Rxc1+ dxc1=Q+: I get my queen back with material even now.
moves.40. Ka4 Qc7: ! keeping the pressure on with the threat of mate.
moves.42. Kb3 Qxa2+: No way to prevent mate after Kc3 Qc2++. He resigned.
